ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
Thus, the Heart (Qalb) occupied with important thought in religion is not free from the roaming of the Satan (Shaytan), otherwise, whoever is heedless of Allah the Exalted, even for a moment, has in that moment no companion except the Satan. Therefore, Allah the Exalted said: 'And whoever turns away from the Remembrance (Dhikr) of the Most Merciful, We appoint for him a Satan, and he is to him a companion.' And He said: 'Indeed, Allah the Exalted hates the idle youth.' This is because when the youth is idle from work that occupies his inner self (Batin) with something permissible to aid him in his religion, he appears idle, but his Heart (Qalb) does not remain empty; rather, the Satan nests in it, lays eggs, and hatches, then its hatchlings also pair, lay eggs again, and hatch, and thus the offspring of the Satan multiplies faster than the multiplication of other animals because its nature is from fire, and when it finds dry fuel, its multiplication increases, so the fire continually multiplies from fire and does not cease entirely, but spreads gradually in succession. The desire (Shahwa) in the Soul (Nafs) of the youth is for the Satan like dry fuel for fire, and just as fire does not remain if there is no sustenance for it, which is firewood, so the Satan has no scope if there is no desire. Therefore, if you contemplate, you know that your fiercest enemy is your desire, and it is an attribute of your Soul (Nafs). Therefore, Al-Husayn ibn Mansur al-Hallaj said when he was crucified and was asked about Sufism (Tasawwuf), what is it? He said: 'It is your Soul (Nafs); if you do not occupy it, it occupies you.' Therefore, the reality of patience (Sabr) and its perfection is patience from every blameworthy movement, and the movement of the inner self (Batin) is more deserving of patience from that, and this is a continuous patience that is not cut off except by death. We ask Allah for good success by His grace and generosity.
